intro: Malapoenna mappacea, commonly known as the Malapoenna mappacea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
